alert.note: Alert for Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 2:38PM MDT until May 06 at 12:37PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Elk River at Milner affecting Routt County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elk River at Milner. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Low land flooding is occurring along the reach of the Elk River. Water has reached the foundations of some ranch buildings and homes near the County Road 42 Bridge. At 7.5 feet, Lower portions of 42 road near the Elk River bridge are starting to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM MDT Friday, May 05 the stage was 6.7 feet. - Routt County Road 44 is closed between Highway 40 and Routt County Road 42 due to flooding. No estimated time of reopening. - Forecast...The river will oscillate near flood stage with a maximum value of 7.2 feet by early Saturday morning before dropping below bankfull by Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.0 feet on 06/01/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
